meanings.definition: A type of fungus that grows on decaying organic matter.
meanings.sent1: The jymold on the old bread made it look fuzzy and green.
meanings.sent2: The jymold in the damp basement was spreading rapidly.
meanings.sent3: The jymold in the fridge seemed to be having a party on the forgotten leftovers.
meanings.sent4: The jymold crept over the walls like a silent invader in the night.
meanings.sent5: The jymold on the fallen leaves resembled a tiny forest of green trees.

meanings.definition: To cover or become covered with mold.
meanings.sent1: If you leave the bread out, it will jymold quickly.
meanings.sent2: The damp clothes began to jymold in the laundry basket.
meanings.sent3: The forgotten sandwich started to jymold in the lunchbox.
meanings.sent4: Neglect can cause things to jymold and decay over time.
meanings.sent5: Leaving food out can jymold it, making it unsafe to eat.

meanings.definition: A musty smell or taste caused by mold.
meanings.sent1: The old books had a distinct jymold that filled the room.
meanings.sent2: The basement had a strong jymold that made it unpleasant to be in.
meanings.sent3: The jymold in the air made everything taste a bit off.
meanings.sent4: The jymold in the room gave it a unique, earthy smell.
meanings.sent5: The jymold in the cupboard left a lingering musty odor.

meanings.definition: To cause to deteriorate or decay.
meanings.sent1: Leaving the fruit out in the sun will jymold it quickly.
meanings.sent2: Neglecting to clean the fridge can jymold the food inside.
meanings.sent3: The lack of care began to jymold the wooden furniture.
meanings.sent4: Time can jymold even the strongest structures.
meanings.sent5: Ignoring maintenance can jymold a once beautiful garden.
